verses.verse: There was a famine<WH7458> in the days<WH3117> of David<WH1732> three<WH7969> years,<WH8141> year<WH8141> after<WH310> year;<WH8141> and David<WH1732> sought<WH1245> the face of<WH6440> Yahweh.<WH3068> Yahweh<WH3068> said,<WH559> "It is for Saul,<WH7586> and for his bloody<WH1818> house,<WH1004> because he put to death<WH4191> the Gibeonites.<WH1393>"

The king<WH4428> called<WH7121> the Gibeonites,<WH1393> and said<WH559> to them<WH1393> (now the Gibeonites were not of the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> but of the remnant<WH3499> of the Amorites;<WH567> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> had sworn<WH7650> to them:<WH7586> and Saul sought<WH1245> to kill<WH5221> them in his zeal<WH7065> for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063>);

and David<WH1732> said<WH559> to the Gibeonites,<WH1393> "What shall I do<WH6213> for you?<WH3722> And with what shall I make atonement, that you may bless<WH1288> the inheritance<WH5159> of Yahweh?<WH3068>"

The Gibeonites<WH1393> said<WH559> to him,<WH5973> "It is no matter of silver<WH3701> or gold<WH2091> between us and Saul,<WH7586> or his house;<WH1004> neither is it for us to put any man<WH376> to death<WH4191> in Israel.<WH3478>" He said,<WH559> "Whatever you say,<WH559> that will I do for you.<WH6213>"

They said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "The man<WH376> who consumed<WH3615> us,<WH1819> and who devised against us,<WH8045> that we should be destroyed from remaining<WH3320> in any of the borders<WH1366> of Israel,<WH3478>

let seven<WH7651> men<WH582> of his sons<WH1121> be delivered<WH5414> to us,<WH3363> and we will hang them up to Yahweh<WH3068> in Gibeah<WH1390> of Saul,<WH7586> the chosen<WH972> of Yahweh.<WH3068>" The king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "I will give them.<WH5414>"

But the king<WH4428> spared<WH2550> Mephibosheth,<WH4648> the son<WH1121> of Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Saul,<WH7586> because of Yahweh<WH3068>'s oath<WH7621> that was between them,<WH1732> between David and Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Saul.<WH7586>

But the king<WH4428> took<WH3947> the two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> of Rizpah<WH7532> the daughter<WH1323> of Aiah,<WH345> whom she bore<WH3205> to Saul,<WH7586> Armoni<WH764> and Mephibosheth;<WH4648> and the five<WH2568> sons<WH1121> of Michal<WH4324> the daughter<WH1323> of Saul,<WH7586> whom she bore<WH3205> to Adriel<WH5741> the son<WH1121> of Barzillai<WH1271> the Meholathite.<WH4259>

He delivered<WH5414> them into the hands<WH3027> of the Gibeonites,<WH1393> and they hanged<WH3363> them in the mountain<WH2022> before<WH6440> Yahweh,<WH3068> and all seven<WH7651> of them fell<WH5307> together.<WH3162> They were put to death<WH4191> in the days<WH3117> of harvest,<WH7105> in the first<WH7223> days,<WH8462> at the beginning of barley<WH8184> harvest.<WH7105>

Rizpah<WH7532> the daughter<WH1323> of Aiah<WH345> took<WH3947> sackcloth,<WH8242> and spread<WH5186> it for her on the rock,<WH6697> from the beginning<WH8462> of harvest<WH7105> until water<WH4325> was poured<WH5413> on them from the sky.<WH8064> She allowed<WH5414> neither the birds<WH5775> of the sky<WH8064> to rest<WH5117> on them by day,<WH3119> nor the animals<WH2416> of the field<WH7704> by night.<WH3915>
It was told<WH5046> David<WH1732> what Rizpah<WH7532> the daughter<WH1323> of Aiah,<WH345> the concubine<WH6370> of Saul,<WH7586> had done.<WH6213>

David<WH1732> went<WH3212> and took<WH3947> the bones<WH6106> of Saul<WH7586> and the bones<WH6106> of Jonathan<WH3083> his son<WH1121> from the men<WH1167> of Jabesh Gilead,<WH3003> who had stolen<WH1589> them from the street<WH7339> of Beth Shan,<WH1052> where the Philistines<WH6430> had hanged<WH8511> them,<WH3117> in the day that the Philistines<WH6430> killed<WH5221> Saul<WH7586> in Gilboa;<WH1533>

and he brought up<WH5927> from there the bones<WH6106> of Saul<WH7586> and the bones<WH6106> of Jonathan<WH3083> his son:<WH1121> and they gathered<WH622> the bones<WH6106> of those who were hanged.<WH3363>

They buried<WH6912> the bones<WH6106> of Saul<WH7586> and Jonathan<WH3083> his son<WH1121> in the country<WH776> of Benjamin<WH1144> in Zela,<WH6762> in the tomb<WH6913> of Kish<WH7027> his father:<WH1> and they performed<WH6213> all that the king<WH4428> commanded.<WH6680> After<WH310> that God<WH430> was entreated<WH6279> for the land.<WH776>

The Philistines<WH6430> had war<WH4421> again with Israel;<WH3478> and David<WH1732> went down,<WH3381> and his servants<WH5650> with him,<WH3898> and fought against the Philistines.<WH6430> David<WH1732> grew faint;<WH5774>

and Ishbibenob,<WH3430> who was of the sons<WH3211> of the giant,<WH7497> the weight<WH4948> of whose spear<WH7013> was three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> shekels of brass<WH5178> in weight,<WH4948> he being armed<WH2296> with a new<WH2319> sword,<WH559> thought to have slain<WH5221> David.<WH1732>

But Abishai<WH52> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> helped<WH5826> him,<WH5221> and struck the Philistine,<WH6430> and killed<WH4191> him.<WH582> Then the men of David<WH1732> swore<WH7650> to him,<WH559> saying, "You shall go<WH3318> no more out with us to battle,<WH4421> that you don't<WH3518> quench the lamp<WH5216> of Israel.<WH3478>"

It came to pass after this,<WH310> that there was again war<WH4421> with the Philistines<WH6430> at Gob:<WH1359> then Sibbecai<WH5444> the Hushathite<WH2843> killed<WH5221> Saph,<WH5593> who was of the sons<WH3211> of the giant.<WH7497>

There was again war<WH4421> with the Philistines<WH6430> at Gob;<WH1359> and Elhanan<WH445> the son<WH1121> of Jaareoregim<WH3296> the Bethlehemite<WH1022> killed<WH5221> Goliath<WH1555> the Gittite<WH1663>'s brother,<WH6086> the staff of whose spear<WH2595> was like a weaver<WH707>'s beam.<WH4500>

There was again war<WH4421> at Gath,<WH1661> where there was a man<WH376> of great stature,<WH4067> who had on every hand<WH3027> six<WH8337> fingers,<WH676> and on every foot<WH7272> six<WH8337> toes,<WH676> four<WH702> and twenty<WH6242> in number;<WH4557> and he also was born<WH3205> to the giant.<WH7497>
When he defied<WH2778> Israel,<WH3478> Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Shimei,<WH8092> David<WH1732>'s brother,<WH251> killed him.<WH5221>
These four<WH702> were born<WH3205> to the giant<WH7497> in Gath;<WH1661> and they fell<WH5307> by the hand<WH3027> of David,<WH1732> and by the hand<WH3027> of his servants.<WH5650>
